name: 應用統計方法（一）
description:
Applied Statistical Methods covers the fundamental understanding of statistical methods necessary to deal with a wide variety of practical problems.



Introduction  the importance of statistical analysis and data summarization
The fundamental principles of probability
Statistical tests of hypotheses; point and interval estimation 
Analysis of variance (ANOVA);  and analysis of covariance
Blocked designs; 
Factorial design
Simple and multiple Linear Regression(I)
Simple and multiple Linear Regression(II)
Simple and multiple Linear Regression(II)
The students are expected to use R for their homework and project.
goals: 能理解統計領域的相關理論
能應用統計領域的相關方法
能使用軟體進行統計分析
syllabus:
Statistics is a branch of science that deals with the collection, organisation, analysis of data. It is about drawing of inferences from the samples to the whole population and to make decision.  An adequate knowledge of statistical methods is necessary for findings meaning conclusions. This course will try to acquaint students with the basic research tools that are useful while conducting various studies. The course covers exploratory data analysis,  an understanding of quantitative and qualitative variables, parametric and non-parametric tests used for data analysis, analysis of variance, linear regression, logistic regression and classification.

1.  Exploratory Data Analysis:  quantitative and qualitative data
2.  Sampling distributions
3.  Statistical Experiments and Significance Testing
4.  Analysis of Variance
5.  A/B test 
6.  Simpel and Multiple Linear Regression and Analysis of Covariance
7.  Model selections and Cross Validation
8.   Logistic regression and Classification

The students are expected to use R or Python for their homework and project.
